info.title: Kitsu API
info.description:
## Welcome to the Kitsu API specification ```Version: 0.17.37``` The Kitsu API allows to store and manage the data of your animation/VFX production. Through it you can link all the tools of your pipeline and make sure they are all synchronized. An easy to use Python client to access this API is available: [Python Kitsu Client documentation](https://gazu.cg-wire.com/) ## Authentication

Before you can use any of the endpoints outline below, you will have to get a JWT token to authorize your requests. You can get a authorization token using a (form-encoded) POST request to ```/auth/login```. With curl this would look something like ```curl -X POST /auth/login -d "email=&password=```. The response is a JSON object, specifically you'll need to provide the ```access_token``` for your future requests. Here is a complete authentication process as an example (again using curl): ``` $ curl -X POST /api/auth/login -d "email=&password="' {"login": true", "access_token": "eyJ0e...", ...} $ jwt=eyJ0e... # Store the access token for easier use $ curl -H "Authorization: Bearer $jwt" /api/data/projects [{...}, {...}] ``` [OpenAPI definition](/openapi.json)

post.summary: Log in user by creating and registering auth tokens.
post.description: Login is based on email and password. If no user match given email and a destkop ID, it looks in matching the desktop ID with the one stored in database. It is useful for clients that run on desktop tools and that don't know user email.

get.summary: Log user out by revoking his auth tokens.
get.description: Once logged out, current user cannot access the API anymore.

get.summary: Returns information if the user is authenticated else it returns a 401
get.description: response.

post.summary: Allow a user to register himself to the service.
Allow the user to change his password.
post.description: Prior to modifying the password, it requires to give the current password (to make sure the user changing the password is not someone who stealed the session). The new password requires a confirmation to ensure that the user didn't make a mistake by typing his new password.

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to change his password when he forgets it.
put.description: It uses a classic scheme: a token is sent by email to the user. Then he can change his password.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to change his password when he forgets it.
post.description: It uses a classic scheme: a token is sent by email to the user. Then he can change his password.

get.summary: Tokens are considered as outdated every two weeks.
get.description: This route allows to make their lifetime long before they get outdated.

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-enable TOTP.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to disable TOTP.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to enable TOTP.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-enable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

get.summary: Resource to send an OTP by email to user.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to disable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password. Wrong or expired token. Inactive user. Wrong 2FA.

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to enable OTP by email.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to generate new recovery codes.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

put.summary: Resource to allow a user to pre-register a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

get.summary: Resource to get a challenge for a FIDO device.

delete.summary: Resource to allow a user to unregister a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user Wrong 2FA

post.summary: Resource to allow a user to register a FIDO device.

400.description: Invalid password Wrong or expired token Inactive user

get.description: Adds project name and asset type name and all related tasks. If episode_id is given as parameter, it returns assets not linked to an episode and assets linked to given episode.

post.summary: Create a new comment for given task.
post.description: It requires a text, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with given task status.

parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: person ID, name, comment, revision and change status of task

post.summary: Create several comments at once.
post.description: Each comment requires a text, a task id, a task_status and a person as arguments. This way, comments keep history of status changes. When the comment is created, it updates the task status with given task status.

201.description: Given files added to the comment entry as attachments

parameters.name: Comment
parameters.description: person ID, name, comment, revision and change status of task

200.description: All news linked to given entity

get.summary: Export assets linked to a given project as csv.
Export shots linked to a given project as csv.
Export casting linked to a given project as csv.
Export edits linked to a given project as csv.
Export a given playlist as csv.
Export as csv.
Export as csv.
Export as csv.
Export as csv.
Export as csv.
Retrieve last events.
Retrieve all login logs.
Get information about a file that could be a working file as much as an output file.
Return last working files revision for each file name for given task.

200.description: Last working files revision for each file name for given task

post.summary: Create new working file.
post.description: A working file is a file used to produce output files. It is the file the CG artist is working on. It is versioned, tied to a task and a software and requires a comment each time it is created. A path is generated for each file created. The path format is defined in the file tree template file.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, description, comment, person ID, software ID, revision and separator.

get.summary: Return last working files revision for each file name for given task.

200.description: Last working files revision for each file name for given task

post.summary: Generate a working file path from file tree template.
post.description: Generate file path based on several parameters: task, software, mode, revision and separator. Revision can be computed automatically as next revision if not given.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, software, mode, revision and separator.

post.summary: Create new output file linked to assets through an instance of this asset for a given shot.
post.description: Some output files are linked to assets through an instance of this asset for a given shot. Each time a CG artist is satisfied by what he did on a working file, he can create an output file that will be linked to a target instance. It keeps track of the working file at the origin of the output file. An output type is required for better categorization (textures, caches, ...). A task type can be set too to give the department related to the output file.

400.description: Given output file already exists Given person not found Given output type not found

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, output type ID, task type ID, person ID, working file ID, file status ID, comment, extension, representation, revision, number of elements and separator.

post.summary: Get next revision for given asset instance, output type, task type and name.

200.description: Next revision for given asset instance, output type, task type and name

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, output type ID, task type ID.

get.summary: Get last revisions of output files for given instance grouped by output type and file name.

200.description: Last revisions of output files for given instance grouped by output type and file name

get.summary: Return all types of output generated for given instance.

200.description: All types of output generated for given instance

get.summary: Get all output files for given asset instance and given output type.

200.description: All output files for given asset instance and given output type

post.summary: Generate an output file path from file tree template
post.description: Generate file path based on several parameters: asset instance, output type, task type, revision, mode, name and separator. Revision can be computed automatically as next revision in case no revision is given in parameter.

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Asset instance, output type, task type, revision, mode, name and separator.

get.summary: Get all working files for a given entity and possibly a task and a name.

200.description: All working files for given entity and possibly a task and a name

post.summary: Create new output file linked to a given entity.
post.description: Output files are linked to entities. Each time a CG artist is satisfied by what he did on a working file, he can create an output file that will be linked to a target entity (an asset, a shot, a sequence, ...). It keeps track of the working file at the origin of the output file. An output type is required for better categorization (textures, caches, ...). A task type can be set too to give the department related to the output file. Revision is automatically set.

400.description: Given output file already exists Given person not found Given output type not found

parameters.name: File
parameters.description: Name, mode, output type ID, task type ID, person ID, working file ID, file status ID, comment, extension, representation, revision, number of elements and separator.

* `deletions` to list the IDs of annotations that needs to be removed.

JWT Authorization.name: Authorization
JWT Authorization.description:
Format in header: **Authorization: Bearer {token}**. 

 Value example: Bearer xxxxx.yyyyy.zzzzz
